content:
• Monday, March 5, 2012
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) -8% AH after announcing CFO and General Counsel Mitch Edwards will be...

    Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) -8% AH after announcing CFO and General Counsel Mitch Edwards will be resigning as of April 1, in order to "pursue other opportunities, including charitable and humanitarian activities."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide (NYSE:MWW) +8.5% AH after stating it has hired financial advisors to assist in...

    Monster Worldwide (NYSE:MWW) +8.5% AH after stating it has hired financial advisors to assist in its recently-announced "review of strategic alternatives."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • NTRI

    NutriSystem (NASDAQ:NTRI) -6.5% AH, as trading resumes after being halted. Q4 EPS and revenues...

    NutriSystem (NASDAQ:NTRI) -6.5% AH, as trading resumes after being halted. Q4 EPS and revenues came in well below analyst estimates, and results were dismal vs. last year's Q4, when NTRI posted a profit of $0.25/share and revenues were 24% higher at $87.9M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • PAA

    Plains All American (NYSE:PAA) -3.3% AH after announcing a 5M share stock offering, which would...

    Plains All American (NYSE:PAA) -3.3% AH after announcing a 5M share stock offering, which would net proceeds of $411.8M if based on today's close. The company says it will use the proceeds to help pay for its acquisition of BP's Canadian's natural gas liquids business.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHFL

    More on Shuffle Master (NASDAQ:SHFL): In addition to announcing Q4 results, the company says...

    More on Shuffle Master (NASDAQ:SHFL): In addition to announcing Q4 results, the company says it's acquiring Ongame Network, a provider of software and services to online poker operators, for €19.5M-€29.5M in cash, depending on whether online poker is legalized in the U.S. Ongame counts more than 25 online gambling firms among its customers. SHFL +4.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • RASF

    RAIT Financial Trust (RAS) -4.9% AH after announcing a 6.95M share stock offering, good for...

    RAIT Financial Trust (RAS) -4.9% AH after announcing a 6.95M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $38.4M based on today's close. RAIT only says it intends to use the proceeds to "make investments relating to its business and for general corporate purposes."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • SHFL

    Shuffle Master (NASDAQ:SHFL): FQ1 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $56.1M (+28% Y/Y)...

    Shuffle Master (NASDAQ:SHFL): FQ1 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $56.1M (+28% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • QLTY

    Shares of Quality Distribution (NASDAQ:QLTY) slip 2% AH after the company announces the public...

    Shares of Quality Distribution (NASDAQ:QLTY) slip 2% AH after the company announces the public offering of 5M shares of its common stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ1 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $425M (+49.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ1 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $425M (+49.8% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • INN

    Summit Hotel (INN -5.1%) finishes lower after RBC downgraded the stock to Sector Perform earlier...

    Summit Hotel (INN -5.1%) finishes lower after RBC downgraded the stock to Sector Perform earlier today due to the overhangs from its renovations and the re-branding of its hotels.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • CASY

    Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY): Q4 EPS of $0.44 in-line. Revenue of $1.85B (+14.9% Y/Y)...

    Casey's General Stores (NASDAQ:CASY): Q4 EPS of $0.44 in-line. Revenue of $1.85B (+14.9% Y/Y) beats by $200M. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ELY

    Wedbush says Callaway's (ELY +1%) new $399 adjustable driver, the RAZR Fit, is likely to be a...

    Wedbush says Callaway's (ELY +1%) new $399 adjustable driver, the RAZR Fit, is likely to be a hot selling product at the premium price point. The firm believes Callaway is well positioned to gain market share in 2012 and maintains an Outperform rating on the stock with a $9 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • ATW

    Atwood Oceanics (ATW -1.9%) slips despite being upgraded to Outperform at Wells Fargo earlier...

    Atwood Oceanics (ATW -1.9%) slips despite being upgraded to Outperform at Wells Fargo earlier today. Wells cites a recovery in deepwater dayrates and a rebounding market in the Gulf of Mexico.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZGNX

    Shares of biotech firm Zogenix (ZGNX +15.6%) surge on Natty Greene's bullish opinion piece at...

    Shares of biotech firm Zogenix (ZGNX +15.6%) surge on Natty Greene's bullish opinion piece at Seeking Alpha, which advises buying the stock ahead of the company's March 8 earnings report. Greene thinks sales the quarter's growth of ZGNX's first FDA approved migraine therapy drug, Sumavel DosePro, could hit 85%-90% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • SBAC

    SBA Communications (SBAC +1.4%) gains after Wedbush upped the shares to Outperform on valuation...

    SBA Communications (SBAC +1.4%) gains after Wedbush upped the shares to Outperform on valuation earlier today, citing likely upside to management's outlook following the close of the Mobilitie transaction. The firm also raises its price target to $54.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • IRWD

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -5.4%) trades lower after Wedbush cut the stock two notches, to...

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -5.4%) trades lower after Wedbush cut the stock two notches, to Underperform from Outperform, on expectations the company will require significant, additional financing. The firm also lowers its price target to $8 from $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • LOCM

    Local.com (LOCM +1.9%) gains after Ladenburg Thalmann initiates it with a Buy rating in...

    Local.com (LOCM +1.9%) gains after Ladenburg Thalmann initiates it with a Buy rating in anticipation of strong 2012 performance on both revenue and earnings growth. Ladenburg says revenues in 2012 will reach $112.5M, up 41% above calendar 2011, and there's considerable operational leverage in its business model for rapid growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • GM

    Rick Bensignor thinks auto stocks and firms that make automotive components are nearing a...

    Rick Bensignor thinks auto stocks and firms that make automotive components are nearing a long-term secular bottom, and he advocates rotating out of consumer services stocks and into the "beaten down" sector. But the words of support and reports that GM may soon begin selling full-sized pickups that can switch between natural gas and gasoline aren't helping today: GM -1.7%, F -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • GCO

    Genesco (GCO +1.2%) moves up on positive comments out of Sterne Agee, saying its strong Q4...

    Genesco (GCO +1.2%) moves up on positive comments out of Sterne Agee, saying its strong Q4 results indicate it can surpass FY13 guidance. The firm expects the company to benefit from current trends, new businesses, new brands, and improving execution, and maintains its $80 target and Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • AWAY

    HomeAway (AWAY +1.7%) move up on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Citigroup, the company's...

    HomeAway (AWAY +1.7%) move up on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Citigroup, the company's market leadership position. The firm also raises its price target to $33 from $29.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • NATR

    Shares of nutritional and personal care products maker Nature’s Sunshine (NATR +17%) pop...

    Shares of nutritional and personal care products maker Nature’s Sunshine (NATR +17%) pop after strong Q4 results on improving gross margin. NATR earned $0.48/share, reversing a year-ago loss of $0.02/share, and revenue rose 2.4% Y/Y to $92.1M. Income from continuing operations soared 171% to $9.6M, vs. $3.5M in the year-ago period.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM

  • Select coal names take a beating off of a double whammy of a drop in natural gas prices and word...

    Select coal names take a beating off of a double whammy of a drop in natural gas prices and word that China cut its GDP target. Big movers: PCX -9.1%, JRCC -8.6%, ANR -6.6%, BTU -4.6%, OXF -9.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • VNO

    Vornado (VNO -1%) slips after UBS cuts it to Neutral from Buy, citing a lack of near-term...

    Vornado (VNO -1%) slips after UBS cuts it to Neutral from Buy, citing a lack of near-term catalysts and an overly complicated story.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • QIHU

    Citron Research target Qihoo 360 (QIHU -2.1%) moves lower after TechNode's Ben Chiang points out...

    Citron Research target Qihoo 360 (QIHU -2.1%) moves lower after TechNode's Ben Chiang points out Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) has "stealthily released a multipurpose media player." Chiang considers the product a potential threat to Chinese video aggregation products from Qihoo and Youku.com (NYSE:YOKU), thanks to its integration of Baidu's search technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • KNOL

    Knology (KNOL -0.5%) slips after being downgraded to Hold on valuation at Stifel Nicolaus,...

    Knology (KNOL -0.5%) slips after being downgraded to Hold on valuation at Stifel Nicolaus, following the stock's recent +20% pop off of M&A speculation.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • NTRI

    NutriSystem (NTRI +4.6%) picks up steam after it nabs an upgrade from Standpoint Research to a...

    NutriSystem (NTRI +4.6%) picks up steam after it nabs an upgrade from Standpoint Research to a Buy rating on a valuation call to go along with a $16 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • BB

    RIM (RIMM) -4.8% to $13.14, probably on more analyst criticism. Northern Securities' Sameet...

    RIM (RIMM) -4.8% to $13.14, probably on more analyst criticism. Northern Securities' Sameet Kanade slashes his target to $7 from $24 and downgrades RIM to "sell" from "speculative buy." Kanade forecasts that RIM's service revenues will plummet to $2/sub by Feb 2013 from $5. Northern Securities isn't without interest, though. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • ADBE

    Adobe (ADBE -1.5%) drifts lower after Piper Jaffray says its channel checks suggest the company...

    Adobe (ADBE -1.5%) drifts lower after Piper Jaffray says its channel checks suggest the company may see a slight upside to Q1 results, but not much. The firm maintains its Neutral rating with a $30 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • RJETQ

    Republic Airways (RJET -8.8%) unit Frontier Airlines bucks an industry trend by operating...

    Republic Airways (RJET -8.8%) unit Frontier Airlines bucks an industry trend by operating without a hedge on rising fuel prices. Though most U.S. carriers have hedges in place to cover 20%-40% of their fuel costs, CEO Bryan Bedford says Frontier will use lower operating costs and higher ticket prices to make up ground if aviation fuel stays expensive.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • PIR

    Pier 1 (PIR +1.8%) gains after Oppenheimer raises its price target on the shares to $20 based on...

    Pier 1 (PIR +1.8%) gains after Oppenheimer raises its price target on the shares to $20 based on increases in the company's sales and margins, noting that Pier 1's e-commerce launch should boost sales. It maintains an Outperform rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • BVSN

    Shares of BroadVision (BVSN -1.7%) falter on heavy volume with no significant company news on...

    Shares of BroadVision (BVSN -1.7%) falter on heavy volume with no significant company news on the horizon. Technical traders may be behind the action with the stock price slipping below its 200-day moving average earlier in the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (Z -2.4%) reports in a filing with the SEC that monthly unique users of its website for...

    Zillow (Z -2.4%) reports in a filing with the SEC that monthly unique users of its website for February rose 86% Y/Y. Shares moved higher off their intra-day low following the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • SYKE

    Sykes Enterprises (SYKE +7.1%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral at Baird after shares...

    Sykes Enterprises (SYKE +7.1%) is upgraded to Outperform from Neutral at Baird after shares dipped 20% since it reported Q4 results and issued soft guidance a week ago. Baird foresees a rally in the next few months given "easing revenue comps, strong cash position, solid earnings power and attractive valuation."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (FTNT -4.1%) dips on a valuation downgrade to Sector Perform at Pacific Crest, citing...

    Fortinet (FTNT -4.1%) dips on a valuation downgrade to Sector Perform at Pacific Crest, citing increased competition.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • SUP

    Superior Industries (SUP +7.8%) shares jump after Q4 EPS and revenues handily top Wall Street...

    Superior Industries (SUP +7.8%) shares jump after Q4 EPS and revenues handily top Wall Street estimates. Manufacturing inefficiencies continue to weigh on margins, but a big top-line beat suggests things may be turning around. Also, the aluminum wheel maker enters 2012 with a cash hoard of $193M and no debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM -2.5%) sells off after Nomura's Romit Shah claims the chipmaker, which has a...

    Broadcom (BRCM -2.5%) sells off after Nomura's Romit Shah claims the chipmaker, which has a leading position in the market for Wi-Fi/Bluetooth/GPS "combo chips," has lost share at HTC. Shah notes that of the 4 HTC models introduced last week, only 1 contained a Broadcom chip - the others relied on TXN and QCOM chips. Shah adds Qualcomm has a leg up on other ARM (NASDAQ:ARMH) processor vendors in developing chips for Windows 8.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • KATE

    Liz Claiborne (LIZ +2.5%) moves higher after S&P ups its rating one notch, saying recent...

    Liz Claiborne (LIZ +2.5%) moves higher after S&P ups its rating one notch, saying recent asset sales helped it reduce its debt, while cash flow should continue to improve with the recent elimination of operating losses from its Maxx brand.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -5%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP -7.6%) are downgraded at Bernstein, which says...

    MetroPCS (PCS -5%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP -7.6%) are downgraded at Bernstein, which says carriers are being forced to target more middle-market consumers instead of the low end they've built their businesses on. Moving up will pit LEAP and PCS against the likes of Sprint (NYSE:S) and require more spectrum to provide service to such customers, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • CF

    CF Industries (CF -5.4%) trades lower after Citi downgrades shares to Neutral from Buy and...

    CF Industries (CF -5.4%) trades lower after Citi downgrades shares to Neutral from Buy and removes the stock from its "Top Picks Live" list. The consternation over CF is tied to management's decision to lock in 65% of the firm's gas costs for 2012 at prices that could end up being too high in retrospect.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • SCEIQ

    Sino Clean Energy (SCEI +16.7%) extends gains that have more than doubled share prices since...

    Sino Clean Energy (SCEI +16.7%) extends gains that have more than doubled share prices since March 1. The stock has surged since Thornhill Capital, which SCEI's audit committee had engaged to evaluate its financials, gave the company a "clean bill of health" and concluded its fixed asset balances are accurate and unlikely to have been materially misstated.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • AAL

    US Airways's (LCC -7.3%) says passenger traffic rose 7.8% last month, as mainline revenue...

    US Airways's (LCC -7.3%) says passenger traffic rose 7.8% last month, as mainline revenue passenger miles came in at 4.3B. The results showed a modest gain versus the same month last year, but mark its slowest growth since June, 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • JJCTF

    Copper (JJC -1.6%) falls as traders warily eye China's trimming of its economic growth target....

    Copper (JJC -1.6%) falls as traders warily eye China's trimming of its economic growth target. In an ominous indicator, stockpiles at the Shanghai Futures Exchange are reportedly at the highest level since 2003.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • PPO

    Polypore (PPO -8.6%) makes new 52-week lows as the Street weighs the implications of GM's (GM...

    Polypore (PPO -8.6%) makes new 52-week lows as the Street weighs the implications of GM's (GM -1.3%) decision to temporarily halt Chevy Volt production. Stifel (Buy) is slashing estimates, arguing GM's Volt inventory issues could take 3-6 months to resolve, at least unless sales pick up. Electric car battery supplier A123 Systems (AONE -7.1%), which recently warned, is also plunging today.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • JBL

    Jabil Circuit (JBL -2%) dips on a downgrade to Buy from Strong Buy on valuation at Needham. The...

    Jabil Circuit (JBL -2%) dips on a downgrade to Buy from Strong Buy on valuation at Needham. The stock has been a powerhouse recently, gaining 35% since mid-December.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • ANF

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +1.1%) perk up on chatter that the company might be exploring...

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +1.1%) perk up on chatter that the company might be exploring strategic alternatives.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -5.8%) gives back some of its recent gains (I, II) after JPMorgan's Doug Anmuth...

    Zynga (ZNGA -5.8%) gives back some of its recent gains (I, II) after JPMorgan's Doug Anmuth argues investor hopes regarding Zynga Platform and online gambling are now baked into shares, and the impact of new game launches on bookings won't be felt until the second half. Anmuth adds he doesn't expect Zynga Platform, which for now uses Facebook Credits, to change Zynga's "game economics."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 3 Comments
  • CHRM

    Charm Communications (CHRM -8.5%) falls off sharper than other China-related stocks in advance...

    Charm Communications (CHRM -8.5%) falls off sharper than other China-related stocks in advance of reporting Q4 results after the close. Analysts expect EPS of $0.41 on revenue of $80.1M for the advertising concern.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • HAR

    Harman Industries (HAR -4.3%) is one of the biggest decliners in the S&P 500 this morning,...

    Harman Industries (HAR -4.3%) is one of the biggest decliners in the S&P 500 this morning, after Morgan Stanley initiates coverage with an Underweight. Morgan says that despite the company's strong product line, especially in automotive entertainment systems, the rise of personal smart devices poses a significant competitive threat to its "infotainment" offerings.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • BBW

    Just 2 weeks after issuing positive comments about the company, BMO is downgrading Build-A-Bear...

    Just 2 weeks after issuing positive comments about the company, BMO is downgrading Build-A-Bear Workshop (BBW -3.2%) to Market Perform, and sending shares lower in the process. BMO says it has lost confidence in management's ability to execute a turnaround, following Build-A-Bear's Q4 miss, and is unsure if announced restructuring plans will generate sufficient returns for shareholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • CVGW

    Avocado/tomato distributor Calavo Growers (CVGW -2.7%) heads lower after reporting FQ1 revenue...

    Avocado/tomato distributor Calavo Growers (CVGW -2.7%) heads lower after reporting FQ1 revenue of $117.4M (+29% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.18, missing Street estimates by $11.2M and $0.06. The company blames soft tomato volumes for the shortfall. Calavo expects FY12 EPS to exceed its historical record of $1.22, but given the consensus forecast stands at $1.64, more seems to be expected. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +16%) and Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (KERX +18.6%) shares soar on a bullish...

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +16%) and Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (KERX +18.6%) shares soar on a bullish analysis by Jeremy Richards in SA. Phase 3 clinical information is expected within two weeks on their top pipeline drug Perifosine; Richards believes the data is positive and the market has not realized the potential for the two companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • CLNE

    Early strength in Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +4.5%), Westport Innovations (WPRT +2.6%) and Fuel...

    Early strength in Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +4.5%), Westport Innovations (WPRT +2.6%) and Fuel Systems Solutions (FSYS +5.1%) is attributed to reports that General Motors (GM -1.1%) plans to sell pickup trucks that run on compressed natural gas.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) +6.5% premarket after Morgan Stanley says a recovery may be in store for...

    Molycorp (MCP) +6.5% premarket after Morgan Stanley says a recovery may be in store for rare-earth prices after a YTD 25% drop. Yttrium prices rose in February, which could be followed by a rebound in magnetic rare earths, MS says, adding that a seasonal pickup in demand also will help stabilize prices. The firm reaffirmed its Overweight rating and $81 target price.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • BLRX

    BioLineRx (NASDAQ:BLRX) +7.2% premarket after saying it received approval to start a Phase II...

    BioLineRx (NASDAQ:BLRX) +7.2% premarket after saying it received approval to start a Phase II trial of its BL-7040 oral treatment for inflammatory bowel disease. A successful clinical trial could herald a breakthrough in the treatment of IBD, as many current treatments cause severe side effects and are ineffective in up to 40% of patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: China spooks European and U.S. markets by cutting its growth target, sending...

    Market preview: China spooks European and U.S. markets by cutting its growth target, sending S&P benchmark futures -0.2% premarket. Fears of a Greek default and weak PMI data are also adding to the pessimism. However, early losses have eased, indicating that investors are looking to buy on the dips. Cotton jumps after India bans exports with immediate effect. Later: Factory orders, ISM non-manufacturing, Fed's Fisher
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ANIP

    Biotech analyst Adam Feurstein weighs in on the 10.5% premarket run in shares of BioSante...

    Biotech analyst Adam Feurstein weighs in on the 10.5% premarket run in shares of BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) tied to the firm's announcement on its GVAX vaccine - calling out that the firm is "hyping" previously released data.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM | 3 Comments
  • SAVE

    Spirit Airlines (NASDAQ:SAVE) nabs Pinnacle Airlines (PNCL) exec Edward Christie to become its...

    Spirit Airlines (NASDAQ:SAVE) nabs Pinnacle Airlines (PNCL) exec Edward Christie to become its new CFO after the carrier sees David Lancelot move on. Shares of SAVE -6.1% premarket, PNCL inactive.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • P

    Pandora (NYSE:P) +5.6% premarket after Stifel Nicolaus upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with an...

    Pandora (NYSE:P) +5.6% premarket after Stifel Nicolaus upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with an $18 price target. "Pandora has emerged as a must-have tablet and connected device application," the firm writes, and "is building a major market local sales force to supercharge its mobile monetization efforts... We believe Pandora will show vastly improved monetization this year."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANIP

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) announces positive Phase 1 results from a clinical study of its...

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) announces positive Phase 1 results from a clinical study of its GVAX prostate cancer vaccine, with an indication patients responded favorably to the treatment. Shares +7.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • ARCO

    Arcos Dorados (NYSE:ARCO): Q4 EPS of $0.22 in-line. Revenue of $958.5M (+10.5% Y/Y) beats by...

    Arcos Dorados (NYSE:ARCO): Q4 EPS of $0.22 in-line. Revenue of $958.5M (+10.5% Y/Y) beats by $14M. Shares +5.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • BAXS

    TranS1 (TSON) announces that the AMA approved one of its application for a spinal implant that...

    TranS1 (TSON) announces that the AMA approved one of its application for a spinal implant that aims to help treat degenerative back conditions. The company says it will provide more details on the product during its Q4 conference call - slated for March 8th. Shares +26.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM

  • India, the world's No. 2 producer of cotton, bans all cotton exports, effective immediately. No...

    India, the world's No. 2 producer of cotton, bans all cotton exports, effective immediately. No explanation of the embargo has been offered. Cotton futures jump 4.5% to $0.92.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 AM | 5 Comments

  • European stocks extend losses after weak eurozone PMI data. London -0.6%. Paris -0.9%. Frankfurt...

    European stocks extend losses after weak eurozone PMI data. London -0.6%. Paris -0.9%. Frankfurt -1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 AM
  • BP

    Now that BP (NYSE:BP) has reached a settlement with Gulf oil spill plaintiffs, the focus is...

    Now that BP (NYSE:BP) has reached a settlement with Gulf oil spill plaintiffs, the focus is shifting to the civil and criminal fines BP potentially faces. The civil pollution fines alone could run as high as $17.6B. BP +2.2% in London, on relief over the settlement with plaintiffs.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 AM
